message.content:
cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CL

The paper discusses a context-sensitive recommender system to support the scholarly communication process, which involves filtering and recommending scholarly resources based on various problem-solving scenarios that researchers face. This aligns with several sub-categories of computer science, including Information Retrieval (cs.IR), Digital Libraries (cs.DL), Social and Information Networks (cs.SI), Cybersecurity (cs.CY), and Computation and Language (cs.CL). However, since the focus is primarily on information filtering and recommendation, cs.IR and cs.DL are the most likely sub-categories, followed by cs.SI, cs.CY, and cs.CL.
